definitions: A numerical value representing the brightness or darkness of a single voxel in a 3D image, often used in medical imaging or computer graphics.
The specific grayscale value assigned to a voxel, indicating the property it represents within a volumetric dataset.
examples: The radiologist analyzed the voxel gray intensity to identify abnormalities.
Adjusting the voxel gray intensity can enhance visualization of certain tissues.
Each voxel gray intensity corresponds to a specific tissue density.
